719508f-a.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Pitt Street
719508f-a.text:
384 (empty lot), 388-392, and 394-396 East Houston Street, north side,
between Pitt and Sheriff Streets, showing the Hamilton Fish Park branch
of the New York Public Library (No. 388-392) and the Down Town Talmud
Torah, a Hebrew school (No. 394-396).
January 17, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
719508f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Pitt Street, Manhattan, NY

719507f-b.title: Manhattan: Houston Street (East) - Avenue C
719507f-b.text:
364-370 E. Houston Street, adjoining and east of the S.W.
corner of Avenue C. No. 3to is a frame house with a brick front.
The 5 story tenement at the right murgin is No. 370. The three
low buildings, No's. 364 to 368 inclusive, between the corner
structure (left, not seen) and this,are to be razed according to
the New York Sun of February 23, 1939. View No. 2 shows the lower
portions of No's 364 and 366.
1932
View 2: January 17, 1928
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York : View
Negative No. 404
P. L. Sperr: View 2
719507f-b.folder: Houston Street (East) & Avenue C, Manhattan, NY

720302f-a.title: Manhattan: Pitt Street - Houston Street (East)
720302f-a.text:
Hamilton Fish Park: A northeastern view across same to East Houston
(left) and Sheriff (right) Streets. This open play area is edually
divided by Willet Street which appears in the center, running from right
to left. Today (1937) the northern half (immediate foreground) has been
improved with a large swimming pool which was constructed by the W.P.A.
under the auspices of Park Commissioner Moses.
About 1922.
Ewing Galloway.
720302f-a.folder: Pitt Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY
